website_summaries.verdict: If your poor cat is suffering from oily fur or dry, itchy skin, there’s no better way to get them to ingest the coat-softening nutrients they need than with the strong flavor of salmon oil.
pros: Salmon oil is packed with omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids to keep cat fur soft
Convenient pump for mixing salmon oil into food
cons: Although we like the option to purchase larger bottles, the bigger sizes may be fairly expensive

customer_reviews.title: Oil high-quality but the bottle and pump stinks
customer_reviews.text: The oil is fine... no problems with that but I've gotten the smaller pump bottle and the larger pump bottle and both of them leak around the top constantly. Every time I use the pump my hands smell like fish my counter smells like fish because the oil drips on everything. it's disappointing that they can't improve the leaky pump
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Adelle my bengal cat loves this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bengal cat who loves food. Anything from cat food, to human food. She loves pizza crust and french fries, go figure. These foods arent healthy for her. I decided to go with this salmon oil so she can enjoy her kibbles a bit more. And ill tell ya, she loves this stuff, and so does her pelt. I noticed shes alot shinier and she looks lean but very solid. And shes much more active she loves to play. Before giving her this salmon oil she was more into her naps more than anything. Now she much more active and she reminds me of when she was a kitten full of energy. 5 stars all day.
customer_reviews.author: samuel rueda

customer_reviews.title: Skin/Fur Savor
customer_reviews.text: My cat had dry itchy skin to the point she was scratching bald spots on herself. No matter what I did or bought nothing seemed to work. After some research I purchased this in high hopes that the oil would help her skin and it did wonders. It took about a month to see results. She no longer has bald spots and her fur is growing back beautifully. Would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GothicNix24

customer_reviews.title: The Wonders of Omega 3 in Salmon Oil
customer_reviews.text: I have a very old dog with an advanced stage of Arthritis. The vet suggested keeping my dog on pain killers to help him with pain. I have read about the benefits of Omega 3 in humans and its attributes to aid with Arthritis and joint pain. I asked the vet if this product could be of help which indicated to try it. The long story short, for the last month and a half, my old dog is able to walk again and stand by himself but best of all; he's not using pain killers anymore. An excellent alternative other than chemicals and pain killers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fernyc

customer_reviews.title: Go to walmart
customer_reviews.text: This same product is sold at walmart for 19.00 for 16oz. I bought 8oz for that. Thought i was gettibg 16oz.🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Toxic, dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: I strongly urge you dont use this for any animal. My husky got very ill all 4 times I gave her this. Made her eyes yellow from toxic liver. After researching product, I found the source of fish they use comes from the waters surrounding fukushima, whixh are highly toxic with radioactive spill. These fiah are toxic for people, and the fda wont allow them to be farmed for human consumption, but there is no regulation stadards for what your dog eats. My healthy husky died 4 months after I started usimg this due to toxic liver, it makes me sad and upset at the same time. Do your research
customer_reviews.author: Sean H.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to read text on label (old style bottle)
customer_reviews.text: You'd think something as important as REFRIGERATE AFTER OPENING would be on the label in type a bit bigger then 4 point text. I had to toss a 3/4 full bottle because I didn't see the WARNING, and just left the pump bottle next to the dry cat food in the cupboard until it started to stink. I think Zesty Paws owes me a new bottle. Either make it visible on the pump bottle or put a flyer in the shipping box in BIG BOLD LETTERS that tells new customers to REFRIGERATE AFTER OPENING.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats refuse to eat it.
customer_reviews.text: We tried mixing it in with our cats' normal food. They refuse to eat it with this salmon oil on it. They normally love the food, but they would rather starve than eat this. Also, the bottle says something on it like "not for human consumption". I'm paraphrasing because I don't have the bottle in front of me. But that little disclaimer makes me wonder what's in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: MLTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Rancid, disgusting.
customer_reviews.text: For me, as a human, VOMIT INDUCING. First bottle, leaked all over, not bad smell. This bottle is completely rancid-I had to bathe my dog after he had this on his food, his face smelled like he had rolled in rotting salmon skins left out in the sun, I was gagging, threw it out. When you can smell it from 5 feet away, not good. I've used fish oil before, and this is the worst. Wont waste my money again.
customer_reviews.author: Mathilda

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Bottle, Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: When I initially bought this item all appeared well, but after one use the bottle and pump started leaking all over. Emailed the company with my concerns as I lost a lot of product but received an automated reply glorifying themself and asking me to review.. My dog does love the product, however I don't like salmon oil all over my hands. Terrible customer service.Will not be doing business with this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Powers

customer_reviews.title: Both of my cats won’t eat it
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say if it is a great product or not. I put the recommended amount in my cats food and they refused to eat it. After 24 hours I tossed the food and gave them new and they gulped it down. Kind of surprised with that reaction because they like fish and are not picky when it comes to food. Unfortunately I didn’t start it right away and waited too long to return it and so stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Leaman

customer_reviews.title: Leaky container!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars for the product,unfortunately I would have to give the container a 1. The container has done nothing but leak since I got it. It leaks out the spout and out around the pump itself. I have lost a lot of the product from the leaking. My daughter's container does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: The cats love it, and the pump is just the right amount. I don't get any unpleasant odor from it. I've been using this brand daily for two cats for about 2 months now - I'm probably 2/3 through the bottle. I do store it by setting it in a tupperware base - as with any pump, it can drip a bit, but I've found it to be quite neat overall. It would be nice if they had small sample packets for a dollar or so - like the ketchup foils at fast food joints. My cats can be very picky, and it would be nice to know if they would eat it before you have to buy a bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki K

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging ends up in wasted product
customer_reviews.text: This is how the oil came in, leaking throughout package and other items I ordered with this, smelled of fish because of it. My dog seems to like the oil but I have to keep it in a plastic bag because it won't STOP leaking!!! Wasted product.
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Mini Schnauzer loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My mini schnauzer has been suffering from what I thought was demodex mange, but turned out to be allergies. He had scratched some hair out around his eyes due to them. I placed him on this and things seem to be getting better, which tells me it may have been a combination of allergies and perhaps dry skin. With this, he gets moisture from the inside as well as he just laps this stuff up! He loves the taste and I love that he loves it and it's healthy for him.
customer_reviews.author: Nihala M.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love it! Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: Dogs Love it! Great Dane, Husky/shepherd mix, chocolate lab/pit bull mix .... They eat it with no problems! All my dogs are rescues - the Dane being newest house member - his coat looked pretty bad. After using this product he looks great! Husky mix is the old timer and has joint issues ... seems to help. Does cause smelly gas and is a bit pricey, but for my babies the benefits out weigh the odors!
customer_reviews.author: CalJax

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, leaked in package and fish smell got ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy, leaked in package and fish smell got on my other products and wouldn't wash off. Pumped on dog food and leaked around the pump and got on my hands and can't get the fish smell out of my hands. It's a shame that any product has to get one star solely for the packaging. Manufacturer should realize they need a heavy duty packaging with a product that has a repugnant smell. I had to stick the bottle in a ziplock bag and poke a small hole to stick out the nozzle. when it runs out i'll buy another brand
customer_reviews.author: Hami

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old foster dog definitely approves!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. Recently I was at the vet with my senior foster pup. I was told that she has some arthritis and was recommended this product to try. She absolutely loves it! I pump a few quiets in her food and she gobbles it up. I was worried about the smell but it’s not strong or offensive at all. I will definitely continue giving her this. I’ve already noticed a difference in her joints and her hair is looking beautiful which is a nice added plus!
customer_reviews.author: flygirly

customer_reviews.title: Already noticing improvements in my dog's coat and dry skin
customer_reviews.text: Give this to my 6 month old puppy twice a day after he was having uncontrollable itching fits. Have been using for 2 weeks and I have noticed a significant difference in the itching and his coat. Will definitely buy again once this bottle runs out. He doesn't seem to mind or notice the smell/taste. Other reviews have had issues with the pump but mine seems to be working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it salmon oil?  Not so sure.
customer_reviews.text: This is an odd product for me. I've been giving my pugs salmon or krill oil for years and this is the first one that is creamy white in color. I swear, it almost looks like semen. It has no odor, which I suppose is a good thing, but again, I've never ordered a salmon oil without an odor. I'm sincerely wondering if it's actually salmon oil or if we got totally ripped off. Even worse, it gives my pugs gas. None of the other brands I've purchased have. Personally, I'd choose a different option.
customer_reviews.author: BridgettTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great company!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this oil as a supplement to my ten year old Maine Coon's recent diet change. His stomach had become much more sensitive as he aged and I noticed his fur became more prone to matting and a lack luster appearance which had never been an issue in earlier years. He LOVES the flavor. One pump on his good daily and I've definitely noticed the change! He's more eager for his food and his coat is back to it's smooth, lustrous appearance. The company is also fantastic! They're always sending special offers for repeat customers of their great products - haven't tried any of their products yet without satisfied success!
customer_reviews.author: Verilaud

customer_reviews.title: Great product from Alaska that helps my dog's skin.
customer_reviews.text: My dog (6-year old Bichon) has the nicest coat and healthy skin, and I believe it's from using Zesty Paws Wild Alaskan Salmon Oil for Dogs & Cats.. Even my groomer thinks so. No more itching or scratching. I don't notice any fishy smell, which is a plus. My dog just loves it. I just squirt the recommended dosage in her bowl with her canned dogfood, and she eats everything right up. She has never given me any problem with it being on her food nor has she right from the beginning. I'll be using this product for a long time. It seems to be at a fair price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Allen

customer_reviews.title: Helps my dog's skin remain healthy
customer_reviews.text: My dog was having a terrible problem with his skin after having fleas. Even after the fleas were gone, he was always scratching and licking, causing his skin to be red and sore. To complicare things he is also very, very picky about what he'll eat -- food or medication. Fortunately, he loves the taste of this salmon oil. And, after a just few weeks of putting this oil on his food, his skin started to improve. It did not fix the problem completely. Several months after I started giving him the salmon oil, I started using a prescription shampoo on him. But the salmon oil has definitely helped and I continue to put it on his dinner every day!
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: Garbage eating dog couldn't stomach it
customer_reviews.text: This has a really strong, awful odor. I could deal with it if my (not at all picky) dog would eat it, but she wouldn't touch it, wouldn't even eat around it if it was in her food. I bought this because it was less expensive than what I was giving her, but then realized the serving size on this product was *double* what I usually buy so no money savings anyway. Lastly, the pump mechanism arrived broken but that didn't bother me as it's easier/safer to store with a closed lid.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a Hit with my Pups
customer_reviews.text: My dog hasn't been eating since our other pup passed away. I was poking holes in my fish oil polls and squirting it on his food to get him to eat. So I bought this since it's highly rated and pops up under Amazon recommended. My pup will not eat his food. Like at all now. It has a very irony smell, like pennies and he won't go near it. Even our foster puppy isn't impressed. Super bummed, but glad I didn't get the big one. I'm sure other pups like it, but my garbage disposals didn't. No fault of the brand, just my picky pups.
customer_reviews.author: LFernan85

customer_reviews.title: Quality Ingredients for Healthier Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats have been doing well in their golden years and I believe that it’s largely due to their diet. I’m not a cook-their-meals-from-scratch type but I do read labels and keep their canned, refrigerated and dry food types higher quality ingredients than your cheap grocery store brand pet foods. This supplement would be on that upper shelf of ingredients I like to offer my cats and it not only improves their overall well-being (if you’re healthy inside, it shows on the outside!), but it can also often “save” a cat food flavor that the cats are not so excited about. It’s a win-win!
customer_reviews.author: SleepySin

customer_reviews.title: My cats can’t stand it!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this. The pump doesn’t work. It won’t even pop up so I can use it! I spent forever trying to twist it like it says to pop it up but it wouldn’t work. I resorted to using a medicine syringe. When I added this to my cats food they wouldn’t touch it. So much so that they didn’t even wake me up for food again until 9am the next morning and when I tried the vitamin again they wouldn’t touch it. Sad for the two perfectly good bowls of food to be wasted and super sad to waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Messed up my dogs stomach.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this made both of my dogs have uncontrollable diarrhea. One of them also started throwing up as well. I even used less than the advised amount. I will be going back to previous brand I was using.
customer_reviews.author: A SOSA

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great packaging, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd has Symmetrical Lupoid Onychodystrophy and it was recommended to us that we add a fish oil supplement to his diet. This fish oil is perfect because it's the highest quality salmon oil which was recommended, it comes with a convenient pump to dispense it which minimizes the mess, it doesn't smell 'fishy' and our dog loves the taste on his food.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Our cat says your cat should try this too!
customer_reviews.text: Our crotchety old cat is exceptionally finicky so I was quite surprised how quickly she took to Zesty Paws being added to her dry kibble. Adding this supplement to her food was suggested by our vet and after some research on Amazon I picked this brand. I know it might take a few weeks to see some clear results but we are hopeful. We definitely have not seen any negative side effects. Like any pet owner, especially one with an older pet, we are hopeful this helps our cat age gracefully while still maintaining her activity level. I will update this review if needed. Meanwhile I plan on continuing to use and purchase Zesty Paws going forward!
customer_reviews.author: Todd A Russell

customer_reviews.title: Pump dispenser works great
customer_reviews.text: I add this salmon oil to my dogs food. It doesn’t have an overwhelming fish smell, which is nice. The pump dispenser is what led me to this specific item. I had bought other oils that were not in a pump dispenser and the oil would end up dripping down the bottle, on my hands, on the refrigerator shelf etc. This dispenser was the only one I have used where the oil does not end up places you do not want it. A+ on packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Vada

customer_reviews.title: My dogs are finally eating their food!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver! Before buying this, my dogs would turn their nose at their healthy/expensive dog food. But now I just squirt a little bit of this on their food, shake it up, and they devour every single kibble. Not only does this help them enjoy their food but it also does wonders to their skin and fur. My gsd has the silkiest and softest fur I’ve ever seen. This product has truly transformed my dogs! They’re healthy, happy, and just stunning! I recently ran out of my 8oz bottle and reordered the larger size. For 3 dogs, the 8oz lasted about a month. I’m estimating the larger size to last 2-3 months.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorWho

customer_reviews.title: Shiny Pup with Less Shedding!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic. Yes, it smells like fish (duh). Yes, it gets on your hands sometimes and is hard to wash off. But, my dog has never had fur this shiny and soft. She is a 40 lb lab mix of some sort, and we've noticed reduced shedding as well. Her coat is BEAUTIFUL and we get compliments all the time. To note, we've only been giving her 1/2 of the recommended dose and still had very noticeable changes! We will continue on this dose as this stuff is PRICY! I haven't noticed any other particular health benefits but the reduced shedding and flaking of her skin is enough for to keep buying.
customer_reviews.author: JSchwich

customer_reviews.title: This arrived leaking salmon oil all over the dang place ...
customer_reviews.text: This arrived leaking salmon oil all over the dang place, and you absolutely cannot get the smell off your hands for hours... I ended up returning it because it was such a mess. So... this product review is more for the inconvenience as opposed to how it actually works-- I'm sticking with the salmon oil pills I get from the vet to put in my dog's food to help his skin and coat for the convenience factor, even though this was half the price.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Cats used to like it but now avoid it, and the bottle leaks
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the cats changed their preferences or something changed in the product, but they used to like it but for the last 2 bottles they avoid it. Even though a bigger bottle would be cheaper, I've bought small bottles to make sure they don't get old and go bad. Also the bottle leaks so bad I think the refrigerator shelf gets as much oil as the cats. I switched to another brand and the cats are eating normal again.
customer_reviews.author: ProfileX

customer_reviews.title: After 5 weeks I notice a difference
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on vet's recommendation after our senior long haired cat started getting knotted fur frequently enough to require cutting/shaving out (she's not a fan of brushing, but she usually tolerates it in small doses.) So I started giving her about half a pump of this stuff with her wet food twice a day. She seems to like it just fine, she's eating the same amount of food so it must not taste bad. Anyway now 5 weeks later I would say her fur is noticeably a bit smoother/silkier and we are getting fewer knots. So I would recommend this product for sure and will order more when this bottle runs out.
customer_reviews.author: ClarksonFace

customer_reviews.title: Picky eater loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it! I have a very picky eater and she cleaned her bowl. That said, she has done this before with new things added to her food so time will tell. Here's what I don't like. I'm 65 with arthritis in my hands. I had to use a knife to get the blue seal off the bottle. Horrible!! The other thing: it's really hard to read any information off the bottle against the Orange background! Even with my glasses on. Add: 10/18/20- my westie is having diarrhea from this product so I am throwing it away. She does love it. I would change my rating to 1star!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff! Gets treated as a treat.
customer_reviews.text: When I read that salmon oil was best kept a month or less, I threw out my big, months-old bottle and ordered this smaller size. The oil is definitely fresher, and I don't mind the mild salmon scent. Our cat and two dogs all love the oil. After taking it a week, I think my eleven-year-old feels more comfortable because she's not complaining when hopping off the bed. Years ago our cat had a torn ACL, and I'm giving this to her prophylactically. Two of the three fur people are very particular about their food, and the oil definitely passes muster.
customer_reviews.author: zekwean

customer_reviews.title: It really helps with my dogs’ coats and skin
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a try after our newly adopted dog turned out to have dandruff and really itchy skin. After about a week, there is no dandruff and he’s not itching. And the bonus is that we were giving it to our other dog as well, even though her skin was fine, and her long coat got really shiny. I’m surprised with how well this oil works.
customer_reviews.author: Snupydecat

customer_reviews.title: A Mixed Bag
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on our old cat, 16 years old. She had been dealing with dry skin, scratching occasionally. This product worked wonders on her skin and her fur became softer than ever after introducing her to her dry food with a few drops of the salmon oil added. That's the good news. The bad news is that it didn't agree with her and she wound up throwing up with a frequency and volume not seen before. We would back off the salmon oil and she would get better within a day. Maybe she was too old to try it out, or maybe her digestive sensitivity to the salmon oil was too extreme.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Musemeche

customer_reviews.title: Admiring my Frankies silky/shiny coat! So pleased!
customer_reviews.text: My Frankie adopted me after being a stray for sometime. He came to me with many skin conditions and a very lackadaisical attitude to keep up his own personal hygiene. After feeding him a healthy diet and much love and attention he looks amazingly better. He even allowed a real bath and purrrrrrred during the process although I still noticed some dandruff and dry skin. He loves attention and brushing, so gets brushed often but I’m noticing his coats looks even healthier and shinier after using this salmon oil supplement on his daily feeding. He’s a gentle giant in the neighborhood, but a most handsome one at that!
customer_reviews.author: Gizelle Kotschevar

customer_reviews.title: My dogs go crazy for this
customer_reviews.text: Great fish oil! I purchased for my dogs that seemed to be itching a lot more than normal, and one of my dogs wasn't eating her food in the morning. They love it! After just a few days, they aren't itching as much and their coat looks shiny and is so soft. As soon as I get the bottle out of the fridge, they come running to their bowls and they eat most of their breakfast now. I don't use the pump, because it's just easier to store in the fridge just with the flip top. I've ordered 2 bottles so far, and our first bottle lasted 6-8 months. This is the best fish oil I have found
customer_reviews.author: MXGamer

customer_reviews.title: Tired of these pump issues!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this product several times before n have the same pump problems as do many others. I’m sure that this company is well aware of that issue! Why isn’t it being fixed. I guess I should check other sellers n see if this is an Amazon issue or widespread. Time to redesign the pump or get a new pump manufacturer! Make it a squeeze bottle like dish liquid. Geez!
customer_reviews.author: AmzPrimeVIP

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: My dog is eating it with her food. I was giving her Salmon oil before, so her coat and skin continue to look good and healthy. She had severe dry skin before I started her on the salmon oil, the oil cleared up her skin she now only has occasional skin irritations on her legs. Mine came with the flip top and not the pump which I like better I just squeeze some on her food. It smells when it gets on your hands. The pump has gotten better. It works really well. My dogs and cats coats are very shiny and no dry skin.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A. S

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but cats and dog love it!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think all three of my pets would like it. The dog and one cat are pretty picky. It works great to get them to eat food they normally wouldn't be too thrilled about. Although I must say I kept yelling at my dog thinking she was eating kitty food again but realized it was this stuff lol. Not too sure yet how it'll affect their coats but I think my Bengal is looking a little more shiny. I bought this and the Furminator shampoo & conditioner for my dog and the combo seems to be helping. A vet recommend Flax seed oil so I'm going to try that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add on top of meals for my German Shepherd and Husky/Malamute dogs. They enjoy their food a lot more when I put this on it. It has a really strong fishy smell if you mix it in with the food. But if you leave it by itself on top, you won't really smell it. I love adding salmon oil to their food, especially when I make homemade recipes. It's a great nutrient to add for their coats. My only complaint is that I ordered too small of a bottle, just a little more than 14oz. and it went way too quickly between my two dogs. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Upset stomach
customer_reviews.text: This stuff smelled pretty good to me but my dog didn’t like it. My dog also started experiencing the squirts from this stuff, like uncontrollable diarrhea where I had to throw away a dog bed and a pillow because there was so much. I don’t know if my dog was a special case, she is a 13 yr old pit bull weighing 55lbs. I put 2 pumps of the stuff in her food to begin with and was going to increase over time to 5 pumps. Needless to say after 4 days of use and 5 days of diarrhea I had hit the brakes. It didn’t work for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Bunch Family

customer_reviews.title: my finicky poodle likes this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I have a poodle with sebaceous adenitis and her derm vet recommended EPA at a high level. I store it in the fridge. Two measured pumps in her dry chow mixed with fresh veg and a probiotic and she is good to go. I've tried chew bites, soft chewable capsules and other oil pump brands only to have her turn her nose at it. Oddly this doesn't give my standard poodle fish breath, but it does on my medium sized poodle. This is a reorder and I dropped down to the 16 oz bottle because I read it's important to not keep it longer than 3-4 months once its been opened.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G.

customer_reviews.title: Pump does not work
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how the product will work for my black lab and his itchy skin yet but I am very disappointed that the pumper on the product came broken so I have to take the entire cap off and pour it onto his food not really knowing exactly how many pumps I am pouring. I know first world problems but when I purchase a product with a suggested amount of pumps based on dogs wait, I expect the pump to actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it but bigger bottle leaks
customer_reviews.text: I tried it in the 8oz size at first and bumped up to the bigger size thinking I'd get more for my money that way. My cats like it but it is pretty difficult to dispense half a pump as a serving and I have to keep a plate under this bottle because it leaks something fierce at the pump. I wound up throwing it away because my kitchen smelled like fish oil no matter how frequently I cleaned. Great quality oil, poor quality pump.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: What a difference !  This Salmon oil makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: My border collie Zues is 12 yo. Having bald spot issues and dry flaky skin. He also has arthritis. This product smells exactly like fish and I get a good feeling about it ....bc there's no guessing about what it is! Honestly , in the first few bowls of food I added it to my dogs ran like the wind at the smell.. Although , after a few days I couldn't feed them enough and both my dogs started looking better .. And really enjoying their food 💜. I loved it so much I gave my son a bottle for his rescue Pitt puppy (50lbs) ! Nickey also went crazy and is so shiny and energetic 😋.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Razzi

customer_reviews.title: Pump is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy this product again simply because the faulty pump causes the product to be wasted. Wasted product is a waste of my money! As you can see in the provided picture, after you press the pump, it stays slightly depressed which causes a slow leak of the oil. I should not have to pull up the pump dispenser after pressing the pump. That’s not how a pump bottle works. For that reason, I cannot recommend this product. On another note, the oil seems to be fine and my dog tolerates it well. I just wish the pump was functional!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: My Pugs absolutely love this
customer_reviews.text: I started using this earlier this year for my two senior Pugs after their vet advised they should be getting fish oil in their diet. I researched online, found this one, and purchased it based on all the good reviews. I feed each Pug twice a day with their own bowls and put one squirt of this on their food each meal. They just love it, think of it like salad dressing, just swish the bowl of food around and coat it in this. Besides being healthy, it has helped meal times go more smoothly for my picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: John VM

customer_reviews.title: Salmon Oil
customer_reviews.text: Our lab has severe allergies itching, scratching and ear and eye infections every spring. Have spent a lot of money on shots and medications. I read an article on Facebook about Salmon Oil helping out with allergies and arthritis and decided to give it a try. It has worked miracles for our lab. Her eyes have cleared up, shedding is minimal and little to no scratching. And I give it to all our dogs and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pd

customer_reviews.title: Strong Fish Breath
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews are correct... this leaks everywhere. I pull it out of the fridge long enough for the 1 pump needed and right back into the fridge which has helped reduce the leaking. Since my Yorkie started this she had gotten amazingly soft but her breath is a hot shot of dead fish. Lol. Give a little to take a little I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Really Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this salmon oil for my ferrets and they absolutely love it! I give them one pump a day and it’s gone in about a second. Not only do they love it, but it’s actually made their coats really soft! I originally bought it to switch them over from Ferretone because of the harmful preservatives, but I will give them this for the rest of their lives they’ve become to soft and cuddly! I will definitely be buying more when mine runs out. Not to mention the bottle it comes in is super cute and easy to dispense. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Henry & Debra Fraze

customer_reviews.title: I Give This To My Cats
customer_reviews.text: I started giving this product to my cats daily for their skin and coats. They enjoy the flavor of the oil. I put a squirt on their dry food once a day. Their skin and fur is so soft and beautiful. This product has really helped to keep my cats healthy and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Regina M. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: ALL 4 CATS I HAVE HAD HATED THIS
customer_reviews.text: I first got this when my 12-year-old cat was sick and stopped eating... he puked even more when I added this into the prescription food I was force-feeding him. When he passed, I thought the oil would be a good thing to add to my other cats' dry food for a treat sometimes, but every time I have added it to food, either wet or dry, they won't touch it. Even the new kitten I got in December won't touch it. If I were you I wouldn't waste your money on something that 4 different cats refused to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My fur baby is about 15 years old. I saved her off the street so I'm not positive about her age. The past year she was slowing down and her fur didn't look good. Her coat was dull and she was losing a lot of hair, seemed like she was stressing. I've been using this product everyday since I got it and man!!! what a difference! She will get one more bath before winter sets in completely and I am adding premium wet food on top of the dry, along with this product, she is doing much better. I can SEE the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: 2/3 of the pumps ordered arrived broken. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.text: Every other bottle pump (2 of 3) we have received when purchasing this has been broken. We ended up saving the 1 working one we received and have been transferring it between bottles when we get a new one. We put this oil in our dogs food. Works wonders on our pit mix’s very sensitive dry skin and our mastiff mix puppy loves it too. Update 1/23/2020 We have YET AGAIN received a broken pump. This time the entire head of it split in half as I was screwing it on...still using the first pump we ever got from April of last year. Kind of amazing how bad the quality of pump is.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C. Neel

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for my GSD
customer_reviews.text: My German shepherd needs this stuff in his diet to aid his itching and also it aids his hair health. It does help with shedding a little as well. He does like the taste for the first few days, as I switch him from capsules to liquid sometimes to change it up for him.. but it seems to get boring on the 3rd or 4th day and he is more likely to turn his nose up to it. Otherwise the product seems legit, don't know how long it will last compared to the capsules i use. We will have to wait and see!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken/waiting on cs
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried actual product. Will update review if I do (for both dog/cat). The bottle and pump arrived wrapped in a bubble wrap packet, which was soaked in fish oil because the unsealed bottle was cracked (not crushed). Almost half the product is gone. I'm trying to find out if the bottle is suppose to have a seal on it and if I can get a replacement bottle. Will update when I get solutions/answer from zestypaws.com. *Side note: the pump doesn't work. I saw other reviews with pump problems, so I tried to pump water with it and it wouldn't pump.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Anna Lemke

customer_reviews.title: I was hopeful but sadly stopped using it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this stuff on top of her food. The scent was not overpowering though. I was really hoping it would help her cost and itchiness but I wasn’t able to use it for long. After using this for 3 days, my dog started experiencing diarrhea. I cut back the recommended amount in half but she continued to have diarrhea. Even though she loved it, I didn’t love cleaning up after her numerous times a day/night. It was like having a baby in the house again. Shortly after I stopped putting this on her food, her stools went back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: They love the flavor!
customer_reviews.text: My pups love when I put this on their kibble, so the flavor must be good! As for as shiny coat my dogs already had a great coat. I pitched for my little one who has dry itchy skin and so for I haven’t noticed much difference other than she love the stuff on her food. Thanks and I will continue to use if only to get her to finish her kibble!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Great results on 17 year old cat
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my 3rd bottle. My old lady cat, 17 years old, likes the taste and we saw almost immediate improvements in her skin and coat. She was losing hair, it was dull and dry, and she had terrible dandruf. A week of this stuff and her coat was like night and day. Her vet commented what a silky and shiny coat she has. I told her about the fish oil and she thinks it’s probabky helping her joints too.
customer_reviews.author: MoeMoe

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work great for our dog
customer_reviews.text: We have an 80-85lb white American shepherd whose belly was always inflamed and warm to touch due to his excessive itchiness. Been using this stuff in every meal for 3 weeks and have noticed him itching much less and his belly doesn’t appear as red and warm. He eats it without issues. Our 65lb German shepherd also loves the taste and quickly eats her food when we put some in her food. I don’t notice any smell from it. I have not had an issue with the pump as some reviewers mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Very Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this is a product flaw or mine got damaged in shipping but the squirt pump leaked ALL over the bottle with each squirt. I switched to the regular cap and that still leaks a bit so there's an issue with the seal. I'd estimate I've lost 1/3 of the bottle with the leaks which is really disappointing considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: My kitties are Way less itchy!!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended to get a fish oil for my cats, because they have been so itchy lately! I thought they had something, like a mite or something, but she said try a fish oil first...Because it helps there skin and coat...so, I found this, and the reviews looked good, so I just squirt it on thier food. Boy, in just under a week, I noticed not one of them is scratching like they were! I slacked for a few days, and they were back to being itchy! Ok! We have a winner in this product!
customer_reviews.author: bzup

customer_reviews.title: Poodle approved!
customer_reviews.text: My poodle was having a little bit of dandruff after a covid home bath. She loves the flavor of this salmon oil. I’m only giving her 1/4 tsp with her morning meal and her flakes are already gone. She weighs almost 8 lbs & can probably have 1/2 tsp, but so far 1/4 is enough. Only con is that the provided pump never worked & the oil does drip down the side of the bottle even when being very careful while pouring... so I’ve wasting a little. Wish a better pump was provided.
customer_reviews.author: BSTOF7

customer_reviews.title: Helped the itching!
customer_reviews.text: This has all but eliminated my foster dog's itching and scratching, thankfully. We knew it wasn't flea/tick/mange, etc. but weren't sure about seasonal allergies or just dry skin. I haven't had any issue with the pump itself as others have reported, and the smell isn't as bad as I was expecting. Subtly fishy for sure, but all my dogs eat it up. I noticed the foster lab may smell a little fishy today so he either got it on his head (definitely a possibility) or I may have to dial back the amount given to maintain his itchless comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Robin F

customer_reviews.title: Works and my dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: I had two dogs that lived a good long life. They were always active even though arthritis had settled in. My vet recommended to put them on a fish oil supplement and it kept them going for a long time. I still have one active 13 yr old and her newly adopted friend of 4 yrs that get a couple of pumps of Salmon oil every night with their supper. It doesn’t have a super fishy smell and the dogs seem to really like it. It comes in a sealed bottle and a pump attachment. My gods are medium/large size so a couple of pumps is all the need.
customer_reviews.author: N. Abdallah

customer_reviews.title: I love it and so does the dog!
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a dog in July who had a severe skin allergy of sort and was extremely itchy and he also had a horrible coat. Fast forward to now he still has some skin problems but his coat is AMAZING! Shiny, silky, smooth, and his balding has gone away. To top it off he loves it on his food!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Ah it not as great as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Well I am disappointed mainly because the dispenser stopped working especially as it got lower. When I have done the capsules of fish oil on my dogs their coats were nice and silky smooth. After using this for a month or so I notice their coats are dull and frizzy not as nice so not sure how authentic this product is.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Shiny lil miniature pincher!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10-12 pound min pin, we started with one pump on her dinner. Noticed after a few days her coat did get real shiny and soft. Then after about a week we did notice that she started to smell a little fishy. Now we just give her a half a pump once or twice a week. We were lucky that we got one with a pump that works (or that I was able to unscrew the pump from the base cautiously without breaking it). Also the product it’s self does not smell!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dog's skin and coat
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs had flaky dry skin before using this oil. Easy, not messy squirt on top of the dog food and the dogs loooove it. Slight fishy smell in the dog's breath but not noticeable after they drink some water. I've tried other brands and the fish breath is so bad it stunk up the house. This is not that. Best of all, dog's skin has cleared up. I notice a difference when I run out and slow to get a refill - their skin gets itchy without the supplement.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Easy supplement
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my cat who tends to have rather coarse hair that mats easily. Being on a fish oil supplement helps keep her hair soft and shiny. Since using this product I have not had to cut any mats out of her hair. She doesn't seem to really love it but she will eat it because I put it on her food. It is very easy to just put one or two pumps on the food. I tried to give her fish oil capsules but she really didn't go for that so I am glad to have something that is easy to get into her. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. P.

customer_reviews.title: Both of my cats hate this.
customer_reviews.text: They hate it to the extent that they won't go near any food that I've put in/on. So then I gave it to a friend who has a cat who seems to eat most anything. That cat wouldn't touch it, either. Surprising, since cats usually like fish/seafood. So....dogs are generally less particular about what they smell and eat than cats. So maybe this works well with dogs. But at this price--I'd think twice before purchasing for cats. For me, it was a waste.
customer_reviews.author: JcatTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Salmon oil is really good for your dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My almost 6 year old German shepherd has really dry itchy red skin in the winter time. I’ve been giving him another brand of salmon oil and it was working really well until I stopped finding it at Walmart. I decided to order some of amazon and I can say the 8oz bottle for about $15 isn’t the cheapest but I can sure say my dog loves it. I need to give him at least a full month so I can see if this stuff actually works. I’m sure it will though because I’ve used salmon oil before and I found it very helpful for dogs with extremely dry red and itchy skin.
customer_reviews.author: marc eathorne

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: EDIT TO UPDATE: Zesty Paws has made good on the faulty pump in just a matter of days. Product delivered today and I am thoroughly pleased. Can't ask for better customer service than that!! I've only given a small amount to my cat and she seems to like it. My complaint is about the pump that comes with it. It does not work!!! Using the regular cap on it always seems to drip some extra out and, since this is an oil, it gets too messy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: This product did nothing to help my poor dog that itches constantly. It's a nice size, like the pump and the taste is good because my dog gobbles it all up. The ingredients are good and are a nice addition to their diet. However, did not help at all with the itch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin Raisin

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't hate it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't hate it and she's a very picky eater for an American English Coonhound, Lab mix. I bought this mainly to help with her shedding. My dog sheds her fur like nobody's business and I couldn't take it anymore so I did some research online to which I found out omega fatty 3 oils could be a solution and after using it for a couple months now I have noticed that my dog hasn't been shedding as much fur like before. I will continue to purchase this for as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jennessa

customer_reviews.title: Super soft fur and no more dry skin
customer_reviews.text: My cocker spaniel has a thyroid problem. The vet wanted him on steroids, anti itch, and his thyroid medication I did not want that little thing loaded up with so much drugs so I asked if there was natural supplements I could give him. She suggested fish oil, knowing he loves moist food and salmon it would be a great way to get him to eat again. He eats like a champ, his hair is soft again, and he is no longer itching from dry skin. Only downside is sometimes the kids out too much on and he has some left overs on his beard so I have to wash his face or smell fish all night.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic! Both of my dogs love it! My vet suggested I try using a salmon oil for my senior dog, who is quite the picky eater. I tried others in the past and either my dog wasn't a fan or the bottle was so leaky, I refused to rebuy. I stumbled upon this brand and gave it a shot. So glad I purchased this brand! He devours his food now and I have had zero issues with the bottle leaking! Will definitely keep buying!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey L

customer_reviews.title: Dandruff Solution
customer_reviews.text: My black cat had really bad dandruff this winter, and after some research I learned about how salmon oil can help. With continuous use (one pump in her wet food in the AM and one in the PM) her dandruff slowly started to go away. We just used up this entire bottle and the dandruff is practically gone. I think I'll buy it seasonally for her, she probably doesn't need it during the warmer months. But I can say for certain that this did in fact work for her!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Barkley the Saluki has gone crazy with this supplement. It works like a charm. Barks had very dry skin and during winter it would get worse. He was permanently shedding year round. I've tried different foods, vitamins, shampoos, etc but this has been the only time his coat shines and doesn't shed. He still scratches now and then but, not like before. I normally add about 5 squirts on top of his food and he loves it. I've also started to feed him canned sardines and salmon since I cant get the fresh stuff. It has done wonders to his coat and there isnt fur everywhere around the house. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Helps make cat food more enticing
customer_reviews.text: I've only started using this product a couple weeks ago but my cat seems to like it so far. Sometimes she still won't eat, but I don't think it's the product that's too blame. She suffers from kidney disease so she has issues with appetite. It's definitely smelly stuff and would be a great product to try if your cat is having problems with appetite. Just like with any change in diet, make sure to start out with only a little and work your way up.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog (American bulldog/pit) is very picky, he'll refuse food unless theres cheese in there and he k ew when i put a fish oil geltab in his food and eat around it. He has horrible skin and allergies. We received this yesterday so I cant review his skin improvement but I can review he loves this stuff!! The moment its on his food he gobbles it up! I dont notice a scent and no more fighting him to eat his food or take fish oil. Hopefully itll help his skin!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Morton

customer_reviews.title: Dog with dry itchy skin? Use this!
customer_reviews.text: I have just started giving my two dogs Zesty Paws salmon oil to help with the “itches” that my one dog has. I have two rescue Australian Shepard collie mix dogs . One with allergies and one with dry skin in the winter. This stuff has really helped both with shiner coats and less itch issues. The dogs know what it is now by name and they can’t wait to lick the bowls! They love it and I know it’s good for them. Give it a try!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My golden LOVES this salmon oil. We’ve been using it for a few months now. He’s only three, so I give it to him as a preventative measure. The smell is very light, and as long as you don’t accidentally squirt it on your self, you won’t notice it at all. I’ve noticed the smaller bottles are easier to use, because I can aim them more easily when I squirt the oil on his food. So now I buy the bigger bottles and refill the smaller bottles to use.
customer_reviews.author: Trish L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be sure what the oil is doing for my cat's health
customer_reviews.text: Hard to determine if it's working well or maybe harming my cat? I got it based on some research on how fish oil could be beneficial in older cats with suspected arthritis. I have been adding the oil to her food every night as directed but cant say her coat is looking better (she is a well-maintained cat to begin with) or has become more active. Giving it 4 stars hoping it's doing good for now. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog’s hair and allergies!
customer_reviews.text: I first tried this about a year ago when my labradoodle’s hair was getting dry at the ends. I was recommended this product and bought it and it helped a lot! His hair was softer and not as dry anymore. I eventually stopped giving it to him but this Spring he suffered from allergies for the first time and read that salmon oil can help with allergies and instantly repurchased! This stuff worked! My doodle now scratches a lot less and his hair looks great! He eats it on his food with no problems. I will continue to give this to my doodle!
customer_reviews.author: Anita Granados

customer_reviews.title: Great company, Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to apply to food and not too smelly!! It's helped with the flakey skin on my Frenchie and his coat is super soft and shiny! The company offering this product Zesty Paws is AWESOME!! I've had to contact them with questions and I got a response back super fast. Not a "form letter" type email, but a REAL person answering all my questions and offering assistance when needed! It's a great company and they offer several awesome products!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Dogs seem to like it!
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviews say, the pump leaks. But they do provide a pop top you can use instead which is fine with me. I do not particularly like the scent its quite fishy, but the dogs gobble it right up when we mix it in with their food. At first they were unsure about it, but now they love it. Update after a little over a month of use, i definitely notice my dogs itching less and their coats are even getting softer!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Works great and quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after one of my cats had a noticeable amount of dandruff. We brush her regularly, which seemed to help a bit, but she was still pretty flakey. After using this for just over a week, there is a significant decrease in her dandruff! She has a black stripe running down her back that caused the dandruff to be very noticeable, but now there is almost none visible. She doesn't seem to LOVE the taste of the oil, but it doesn't stop her from eating her food (girl loves o eat).
customer_reviews.author: Sam Orons

customer_reviews.title: Great for coat and flavor for dogs meal
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a big fat so we have to give her some boring healthy food. When we noticed her coat was a bit dry and flaky, we bought this fish oil. Not only did it improve her coat but, she loves it and actually wants to eat her food now. Before she would kind of wait for eve to eat if she would even eat a meal at all, but with the oil added she is back to her younger self eating as soon as we put the food I front of her. Hands down a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product has been amazing for my animals. I never have completes about zesty. The only thing I do have to say is the smell it of course very strong if you open the bottle but once in their food and mixed in you cannot even tell. They love it and my dogs are very picky . I would highly recommend this for any dog . Their coats and shiny and soft and they skin are nice and smooth . They smell to love it and it has all the goodies in one . It is also cheaper than buying a vet prescription one that has the same ingredients in it . Thank smarter not harder dog parents (;
customer_reviews.author: yesenia fernandez

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy and clean to dispense, helped my dog with extreme dry skin
customer_reviews.text: I started to give my dog salmon oil with every meal, due to his extremely dry skin and flakes during a colder season. It helped stop the flaking, and his coat became very shiny and nice. His skin had bad odor due to irritated skin, but after starting to give salmon oil, it stopped. I also changed the shampoo to more emollient type, but this oil really helped my dog a lot. I think it also helps is brain and his joint. This particular brand is a little thicker than other brand I have used, but their bottle is very well designed and it never make a dripping mess like others, and stays clean. Highly recommended,
customer_reviews.author: K&Z

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for our dog!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cocker spaniel that has always had dry itchy skin and recently she’s had terrible allergies. We would have to flush her eyes daily, nothing worked. But this stuff is wonderful! Her eye has cleared up and she doesn’t chew her feet or mess with her hot spot since we started giving this to her Saturday. She loves it, she will eat the food that has the oil on it first before she eats the rest :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old outdoor cat doesn't like fish oil treats so I put a bit of this in her Food bowl and mix it up good. At first she gave me dirty looks and wouldn't eat but she finally gave in after a day and now she eats it fine. Does wonders for her. She walks around more, is more social and doesn't always seem like she is in pain.
customer_reviews.author: MsKaty

customer_reviews.title: Healthy for them, and my dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how wild my dogs get for this stuff. They gobble their food since I started adding this oil. Per the directions. I only add one pump for my adult Frenchie and a few drops for my Boston puppy, and I feel good about adding this healthy oil to their diet. The only thing is that the pump sticks a little, so it can make dispensing a little tricky. That’s minor, though, and I will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie G

product_meta.title: Zesty Paws Pure Wild Alaskan Salmon Oil for Dogs & Cats - Supports Joint Function, Immune & Heart Health - Omega 3 Liquid Food Supplement for Pets - All Natural EPA + DHA Fatty Acids for Skin & Coat
feature_bullets: A tasty & body nourishing treat for cats & dogs - Zesty Paws Wild Alaskan Salmon Oil is a natural fish oil additive supplement that supports the skin, coat, hips and joints, heart, and immune system.
Healthy, powerful Omega fatty acids - This premium Salmon Oil is rich with Omega-3 & Omega-6 fatty acid from EPA & DHA, that can help keep skin & coats soft & support the holistic health of your pet.
Help your pet stay in great shape - The rich Omegas in Salmon Oil help to aid hip, joint, heart, and immune function to keep your pet healthy.

A treat for pets that's easy & mess-free - For pet parents looking for an alternative to capsules or soft chews, all it takes is a few quick pumps of this liquid Salmon Oil to mix nicely with your dog or cat foods. Small, medium, and large breeds love it.

A pet supplement you can trust - Zesty Paws understands how much your pet’s wellness means to you, so they manufacture their Salmon Oil in FDA-registered facilities that are NSF and GMP-certified in the USA.
